Of course, Donald Trump can give a speech without reading a teleprompter. Here, with no edits, is a word-for-word transcript of one such example: “Look, having nuclear — my uncle was a great professor and scientist and engineer, Dr. John Trump at MIT; good genes, very good genes, okay, very smart, the Wharton School of Finance, very good, very smart — you know, if you’re a conservative Republican, if I were a liberal, if, like, OK, if I ran as a liberal Democrat, they would say I’m one of the smartest people anywhere in the world — it’s true! — but when you’re a conservative Republican they try — oh, do they do a number — that’s why I always start off: Went to Wharton, was a good student, went there, went there, did this, built a fortune — you know I have to give my like credentials all the time, because we’re a little disadvantaged — but you look at the nuclear deal, the thing that really bothers me — it would have been so easy, and it’s not as important as these lives are — nuclear is so powerful; my uncle explained that to me many, many years ago, the power and that was 35 years ago; he would explain the power of what’s going to happen and he was right, who would have thought? — but when you look at what’s going on with the four prisoners — now it used to be three, now it’s four — but when it was three and even now, I would have said it’s all in the messenger; fellas, and it is fellas because, you know, they don’t, they haven’t figured that the women are smarter right now than the men, so, you know, it’s gonna take them about another 150 years — but the Persians are great negotiators, the Iranians are great negotiators, so, and they, they just killed, they just killed us, this is horrible.” [-Donald Trump, in a campaign speech with no teleprompter, Sun City, South Carolina, at Magnolia Hall.] —- This above was nominated for The Guinness Book of World Records, as a contender for the “World’s Longest Run-On Sentence.” The Guinness Book of World Records declined to respond.

I don’t think that Trump can give a speech WITH a teleprompter. His State of the Union addresses are akin to listening to a giant balloon let out its air. His whole appeal it in his unfettered, off-the-cuff method of standing up and vomiting repetitive, uncontrolled garbage from his mouth. His followers don’t notice that he is anecdotal and repetitive. His vocabulary is on the level of a fifth grader at best. He is only able to insult and demean, make promises he will not keep, take credit for things he didn’t do and bluster that he conquered a virus that is running roughshod over everyone, including his followers.

Of course he can. That’s by far his favourite type of speech. Free, off-the-cuff, minimal effort. He can probably go on for hours. Most of it will be bullshit, bluster, blame and more bullshit though. Unless it’s about how great, awesome, amazing, perfect, intelligent, funny, kind, generous, brilliant he is. Yeah, thing is he can make shit up, and funnel it directly to his mouth for hours, without first having spent any time in the brain. Which is fair enough, because as we know there is a stain of anti-intellectualism ingrained in American society which prizes action and emotion over rationalism and realism. So he does appeal to a great part of the electorate, who want to see him put on a good show, not be honest and sensible. Yes, the unprompted speech is by far Humpty Dumpty’s favourite.

Sure he can. I’ve seen him do it many time. He opens his mouth and then proceeds to spew one lie after another. For his first encore, he puts one foot in his mouth. Trump puts his other foot in his mouth for his second encore. It fits because he has stretched his lips out with his lies. For his grand finale, he shoots himself in the feet, which are now in his mouth. The amazing thing is how many times he can do it and how many times people fall for the trick.

He certainly can, and this speeches are much better when he doesn’t. That is, if you count “better” as entertaining, unpredictable , and inspiring to Trump Supporters. A teleprompter hobbles him and he reads stiffly and without animation. Whereas when winging it, his youthful, exciting gestures and delivery come to the fore and electrify the crowd of Trump Supporters. And, even more, the impossibility of guessing which hated easy target he’ll go after, or what new target he’ll find to attack, or what flight of rhetorical bloviation, interspersed with gibberish and pure word salad, he’ll go off on this time.

It is said that he goes ‘off script’. Teleprompters are there to assist so the speaker will appear to be lucid. NOBODY wants to see someone get up on stage and ramble. They have been used for sometime. Probably so that the speaker will not have to look down at notes, thereby looking away from the crowd and just reading their speech, head down, looking like a clueless, unprepared fool. Perhaps, try it yourself. How long can you speak from a prepared text and engage a crowd?

Yes he uses a teleprompter there are times when he struggles to read the words given to him. Then he begins adlib which makes his speeches sound even stupider. Trump uses the teleprompter as a hold card because in reality he can’t think for himself he has to use others words to keep him out of trouble but as time goes on that just pleases the crowds that believe these were all his crap.

A great example is his latest rally, 90 minutes long. 5 minutes were spent on his plans for the next 4 years and 85 minutes were his usual word salad blaming other people for everything and out and out lies. No teleprompter needed.

Trump can stand up in front of a microphone and express sounds that may be words. He is not capable of making a speech with or without a prompter. Making a speech involves delivering a message about a or more matters. To do that you need to clearly deliver the facts and opinions that you wish to convey. A series of barely comprehensible rants does not make a speech.
Trump gives tons of speeches without a teleprompter. Look how he answered this question put to him by Hannity. No teleprompter here. No coherence or linear thought pattern, but no teleprompter.
